children.text: Content Standard 1: Students shall apply the essential skills and techniques to perform music.
Demonstrate characteristic tone quality in extended registers using moderate dynamic levels
Demonstrate accurate intonation in chamber music and large ensembles

Demonstrate vertical alignment within an ensemble
  • internalizing beat
  • following conductor (e.g., preparatory beat, tempo changes, meter)
  • varied meters (e.g., simple, compound, asymmetrical)
  • rhythmic patterns (e.g., dotted eighth and sixteenth notes, syncopation, duplets, triplets, tied notes)
  • meter changes (e.g., to )
Demonstrate an internalized beat within a small ensemble without a conductor

Perform scales by memory
  • major (e.g., C, G, D, A, E, B, F, Bb, Eb, Ab, Db, Gb)
  • minor (e.g., a, e, b, f#, c#, g#, d, g, c, f, bb, eb)
  • chromatic

Perform rudiments (e.g., single stroke, double stroke, five stroke, seven stroke roll, nine stroke roll, single paradiddle, double paradiddle, flam accent, flamacue, flam paradiddle, drag, double drag tap, single ratamacue)

Perform instrument-specific technique builders in various major keys (e.g., lip slurs for brass, arpeggios, thirds, etudes, chorales, tonguing and slurring patterns, double stops for mallet percussion, octaves)
Sight-read music literature
Content Standard 2: Students shall demonstrate creative expression through music.
Interpret music of contrasting styles (e.g., marches, suites, overtures, Baroque, Romantic, Classical, ragtime, jazz)
Improvise rhythmic and melodic variations in a specific style and meter
Perform to achieve a characteristic ensemble sound (e.g., blend, balance, intonation)
Demonstrate correct balance and intonation at various dynamic levels relative to the ensemble

Perform fundamental elements and principles of phrasing and expression
  • tempi (e.g., grave, lento, andante, moderato, allegro, presto)
  • expressive markings (e.g., cantabile, dolce, grandioso, maestoso)
  • articulations (e.g., tenuto, staccato, legato, accents, marcato)
  • dynamics (e.g., crescendo, decrescendo, pianissimo (pp), piano (p), mezzo piano (mp), mezzo forte (mf), forte (f), fortissimo (ff))
Content Standard 3: Students shall listen to, describe, analyze, perform, and evaluate music.
Analyze examples of a varied repertoire of music (e.g., classical, pop, jazz, marches)
Recognize the role of a specific instrumental part within a composition (e.g., rhythmic, melodic, harmonic)
Identify characteristics of exemplary performances
Evaluate individual and group musical performances orally and in written format (e.g., journal, blog, graphic organizer)
Exhibit proper etiquette in rehearsal, performances, and audience settings
Content Standard 4: Students shall make connections between music and other disciplines.
Describe characteristics of American music (e.g., "Star-Spangled Banner," "Fanfare to the Common Man," "Rhapsody in Blue")
Describe the role and function of instrumental music in lifelong learning
Discuss musical traditions from a variety of cultures
Identify musical traditions that relate to the historical and cultural context of other arts and disciplines
Describe cultural and technological influences on music (e.g., software, hardware, recording, Web 2.0)
Demonstrate espirit de corps
